intro: Sabia yunnanensis var. mairei, commonly known as the Yunnan sabia, is a rare evergreen shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments, typically found in mountainous regions with acidic soils. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and is often cultivated in specialized gardens. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
